ossj.qos.pm.threshold
Class PerformanceMonitorReportHandler

java.lang.Object
  ossj.qos.pm.threshold.PerformanceMonitorReportHandler
public class PerformanceMonitorReportHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Handles performance monitor reports received by PerformanceDataEvents. Extracts the measurement value from the performance data event and returns it as a String.

Implementation based on 3GPP TS 32.401 V4.0.0 (2001-09), technical specification; 3rd Generation partnership Project; Technical Specification Group Services and Aspects; Telecommunication Management; Performance Management (PM); Concept and Requirements (Release 4).

Author:
Henrik Lindstrom, Ericsson
See Also:
ossj.qos.pm.util.MeasurementReport_3GPP_XML_tags

setURIBase

public static void setURIBase(java.lang.String uri)
Defines the base URI for XML parsing. This is where the parser will look for relative URIs, for instance to the DTD file.

getDocument

public static org.w3c.dom.Document getDocument(java.lang.String report)
                                        throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                               org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                               java.io.IOException
Converts a report into a (XML) Document.

Parameters:
report - a String containing the XML content
Returns:
measurment report as a Document
Throws:
javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if there is a problem with the parser
org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there is a problem to parse the XML document
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the internal ByteArrayInputStream

getMeasurementValue

                                                   java.lang.String nedn,
                                                   java.lang.String mt,
                                                   java.lang.String moid)
Returns the measurement value for the nedn, moid, mt. moid is currently ignored.

Parameters:
doc - XML document
nedn -
mt -
moid -
Returns:
measurement value as a string or null if it is not found.

getSuspectFlag

public static java.lang.String getSuspectFlag(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                              java.lang.String nedn,
                                              java.lang.String moid)
Returns the suspect flag for a nead. Currently the method do not support the moid attribute, which is ignored.

Parameters:
doc - the performance monitor report
nedn -
moid -
Returns:
measurement time stamp or null if nedn (or moid) is not found
